data.title: Crest Nicholson Pretax Loss Widens on Higher Costs
data.description:
By Anthony O. Goriainoff

Crest Nicholson said its pretax loss widened after booking higher costs, and that it was mindful of current macroeconomic uncertainty.

The London-listed housebuilder said Tuesday that pretax loss for the year ended Oct. 31 was 143.7 million pounds ($178.9 million), compared with a loss of 23.1 million pounds the year before. The company booked an exceptional pretax charge of 166.1 million pounds related to fire-remediation provisions.

Revenue fell to 618.2 million pounds from 657.5 million pounds, as home completions fell to 1,873 from 2,020 the year prior. The company said this was due to a weak order book at the start of the fiscal year on low levels of confidence in the housing market.

The company said that at the end of January its forward order book for fiscal 2025 had 1,051 units.

The board proposed a final dividend of 1.2 pence a share, down from 11.5 pence a share for fiscal 2023, taking the total for the year to 2.2 pence, down from 17 pence.

For the fiscal year ahead the company guided for pretax profit in the 28 million to 38 million pounds range.

"With our initiatives and the anticipated stabilization of the macroeconomic environment, we believe we are well-positioned to navigate this evolving landscape effectively," it said.

Write to Anthony O. Goriainoff at anthony.orunagoriainoff@dowjones.com

data.title: Vodafone Group Kicks Off EUR480 Million Share Buyback
data.description:
Vodafone Group on Tuesday launched a share buyback program of up to 480 million euros, according to a same-day filing.

The British telecommunications company is looking to reduce its share capital by buying back up to 4,053,092,397 shares on the London bourse under the scheme. The program will run until May 19, with the targeted shares to be held in treasury and then either canceled or used for employee share rewards.

data.title: Bravida Bags DKK86 Million Contract to Install Electricity Supply Line in Denmark
data.description:
Bravida said Tuesday its Denmark unit secured a contract worth 86 million Danish kroner to install a new electricity supply line in Frederiksberg.

The new 132-kilovolt cable will replace old oil and gas boilers, allowing renewable district heating in the city. Danish transmission company Centralkommunernes Transmissionsselskab is commissioning the project.

The Swedish multi-technical services company will oversee the planning, design, dimensioning and delivery of the cable as part of the contract. Work will begin in March 2025, with entire project completion anticipated by mid-2027.

data.title: Team Internet Performance Hurt by Search Unit
data.description:
By Ian Walker

Team Internet Group said it expects to report lower earnings for last year due mainly to its search unit, which faced challenging market conditions in the second half of the year.

The U.K. media company--which is in 315.2 million pound ($392.4 million) takeover talks with Verdane Fund Manager--said Tuesday that it expects to report gross revenue for the year of $803 million compared with $837 million, and net revenue of $188 million compared with $191 million. Adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization is expected to be $92 million compared with $96 million.

Within this, the search unit's gross revenue fell 11% to $537 million, net revenue fell 15% to $91 million, and adjusted Ebitda fell 24% to $56 million.

Team Internet said, despite headwinds for the search business, the group has prioritized improved customer experience and brand trust over volume growth to strengthen long-term sustainability.

"We are confident that our search division's transition into a more content-rich consumer experience will ultimately set up the division for sustainable long-term growth," Chief Executive Michael Riedl said.

The company ended the year with record cash flow of $95 million, it said.

Separately, Team Internet said that the U.K. Takeover Panel has agreed to an extension for Verdane to make an offer for the company or walk away until March 4 so that the two companies can continue due diligence, negotiations over the terms of a deal, and other pre-conditions.

On Jan. 7, the company said that it received takeover approaches from TowerBrook Capital Partners and Verdane worth 125 pence a share in cash. Since then, TowerBrook has withdrawn its proposal.

Team Internet shares closed at 103.40 pence on Monday. They are currently up 9.9% over the year to date and 15% higher over the past month.

Write to Ian Walker at ian.walker@wsj.com

data.title: Smirnoff Vodka Maker Diageo Scraps Midterm Guidance on Uncertainty in Key Markets
data.description:
By Andrea Figueras

U.K. spirits maker Diageo scrapped its midterm outlook, citing macroeconomic and geopolitical uncertainty in key markets affecting the pace of recovery.

The owner of Johnnie Walker, Guinness and Smirnoff said Tuesday that it has withdrawn its target of organic net sales growth between 5% and 7%.

"We remain confident in both the favorable long-term industry fundamentals and our ability to outperform the market," it said.

For the second half of fiscal 2025, the company had expected to build on the momentum during the first six months and deliver a sequential improvement in organic net sales growth. However, the implementation of tariffs in the U.S. could affect this goal.

As for organic operating profit growth, the group said it will assess the effect of levies and update as appropriate.

For the first half of its fiscal year, the group booked net sales of $10.90 billion in the six months to Dec. 31, beating analysts' estimates of $10.72 billion, according to consensus estimates provided by the company. Sales grew 1% organically on year.

Operating profit stood at $3.155 billion, 5% lower compared with the prior-year period and below analysts' projections of $3.31 billion.

Write to Andrea Figueras at andrea.figueras@wsj.com

data.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Rise as Trump Pauses Tariffs on Mexico, Canada — Market Talk
data.description: Eurozone 10-year government bond yields edge higher, tracking U.S. Treasury yields after the latest twist in President Trump's tariff policy. Trump agreed to postpone the tariffs on Mexico and Canada for a month after talks with the leaders of both countries. Ten-year eurozone bond yields rise about 3 basis points across the board, with the Bund yield up at 2.417%, according to Tradeweb. Eurozone rates are likely to continue to be sensitive to growth risks, ING's Padhraic Garvey and Michiel Tukker say in a note. "Especially the front end may find itself even lower in the near term," the rates strategists say. (emese.bartha@wsj.com)

data.description:

** MISR dropped 2.7% in January, same as India's top state-owned stocks (.NIFTYPSE)

data.title: Euro zone yields rise as markets weigh Trump's tariff plans
data.description:
Euro zone bond yields rose on Tuesday, while investors weighed the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs as levies on China came into effect.

Minutes after the U.S. tariffs took effect, China announced it was slapping tariffs on some U.S. imports. Trump on Monday paused levies on Mexico and Canada at the last minute.

Germany's 10-year bond yield (DE10YT=RR), the benchmark for the euro zone bloc, rose 3 basis points (bps) to 2.42%, after falling 7 bps on Monday.

Yields move inversely to prices.

Italy's 10-year yield was higher by 2.5 bps at 3.527%, and the gap between Italian and German yields (DE10IT10=RR) stood at 110 bps.

Germany's two-year bond yield (DE2YT=RR), which is more sensitive to European Central Bank rate expectations, was up 2 bps at 2.057%.

data.title: HokuHoku Financial's Nine-Month Profit Jumps 48%; Shares Up 9%
data.description:
Hokuhoku Financial Group's attributable net income surged 48.1% year over year in the fiscal nine months ended Dec. 31, 2024, from 21.0 billion yen, a filing with the Tokyo Exchange said on Monday.

Diluted earnings per share rose to 247.95 yen from 162.78 yen in the comparable period.

Ordinary income was up 4.4% to 151.4 billion yen from 145.1 billion yen a year earlier.

For the year ending March 31, the company expects to book an attributable net income of 35.0 billion yen, ordinary profits of 46.0 billion yen and basic earnings per share of 278.50 yen.

Shares of the financial services group surged over 9% in recent trading.

data.title: Diageo CFO: Company Will Provide New Midterm Guidance Once There Is More Visibility
Sirius Real Estate to Purchase German Business Park in EUR20 Million Deal
data.description:
Sirius Real Estate (, SRE.JO) agreed to buy the Reinsberg business park in Saxony, Germany for 20.4 million euros, according to a Tuesday release.

The British business and industrial parks owner said the 75%-occupied property features 37,000 square meters of lettable space.

data.title: Nippon Kayaku's Attributable Profit Zooms 371% in 9M 2024; Shares Surge 19%
data.description:
Nippon Kayaku's profit attributable to owners surged 371% for nine months ended Dec. 31, 2024 to 13.3 billion yen from 2.83 billion yen a year earlier, a filing with the Tokyo Exchange said on Monday.

Profit attributable to owners of parent per share primary increased to 81.02 yen from 17.06 yen in the comparable period.

Net sales were up over 12% year over year to 168.0 billion yen from 149.8 billion yen.

The chemicals company forecasted an attributable profit of 17.9 billion yen for the year ending March 31, a profit attributable to owners of parent per share of 109.58 yen and net sales of 223.7 billion yen.

Shares of the company zoomed nearly 19% in recent trading.

data.title: Tuticorin Alkali Chemicals Sees Sharp Decline in Fiscal Q3 Profit
data.description:
Tuticorin Alkali Chemicals And Fertilizers' net profit plunged to 48.9 million Indian rupees in the fiscal third quarter ended Dec. 31, 2024, against 191.6 million rupees a year ago.

Earnings per share contracted to 0.40 rupees compared with the year-ago figure of 1.57 rupees, according to a Monday filing to the BSE by the chemicals manufacturer.

Revenue from operations in fiscal Q3 increased to 818.6 million rupees from 761.5 million rupees a year earlier.

Reckitt Benckiser Target Cut to 5,360p From 5,530p by Barclays Capital
Reckitt Benckiser Cut to Equalweight From Overweight by Barclays Capital
Swedbank: Odhnoff is Currently Deputy Chief Credit Officer
Swedbank: Odhnoff Replaces Lars-Erik Danielsson on Aug 1
Diageo CEO: Measures Taken Will Position the Group Well When the Market Recovers
Canal+ Proposes Carveout of MultiChoice's Units as Part of Takeover Bid
data.description:
By Michael Susin

Vivendi's Canal+ and MultiChoice Group reached an agreement to carve out part of the South African company as it seeks regulatory approval for the acquisition, which values the firm as a whole at about $2.97 billion.

The French TV company said Tuesday that MultiChoice's current holder of the broadcasting licence in South Africa and the entity which contracts with South African subscribers, MultiChoice (Pty), will be carved out of the company and will become an independent entity named LicenceCo.

As part of the deal, LicenceCo will provide content, technology and other functions through commercial agreements with MultiChoice subsidiaries.

The remainder of the group's video entertainment assets will remain part of MultiChoice.

The companies said they are confident that the proposed structure meets the regulatory requirements, including the restrictions on foreign ownership and control of broadcasting licences.

In April 2024, Canal+--which already owns 35% of MultiChoice--raised the bid to 125 South African rand ($6.68) a share payable in cash from a previous bid of ZAR105 that had been rejected by the target.

Write to Michael Susin at michael.susin@wsj.com

data.title: Genor Biopharma Holdings Postpones EGM to February 19
data.description:
Genor Biopharma Holdings has decided to postpone its extraordinary general meeting to Feb. 19 from Feb. 13, a Tuesday bourse filing said.

The delay was attributed to the company requiring additional time to determine certain information related to the company's proposal to change its auditor from PricewaterhouseCoopers to Ernst & Young.

data.title: Mutakamela Insurance's FY24 Net Profit Slips; Insurance Revenue Up
data.description:
Mutakamela Insurance (SASE:8040) said Tuesday that its net profit for full-year 2024 dropped, while insurance revenue rose year over year.

Net profit after zakat attributable to shareholders for the 12 months ended Dec. 31, 2024, was 15.2 million Saudi riyals, compared with 37 million riyals a year ago. EPS moved to 0.26 riyal from 0.62 riyal.

The Saudi Arabia-listed insurer's insurance revenue was 873.9 million riyals, compared with 862.6 million riyals earlier.

data.title: Assura Delivers First Net Zero Carbon Properties in UK
data.description:
Healthcare property company Assura completed its first two net zero carbon development projects.

The projects, located in Fareham and Winchester in the UK, were developed for a combined 13.6 million pounds sterling and have been handed over to tenants, according to a Tuesday filing.

The Fareham project comprised the refurbishment of an existing high street building into a children and family healthcare center and the Winchester project was a new-build development for a medical practice.

data.title: Vodafone Launches $496.5 Million Buyback After Revenue Rises
data.description:
(07:01 GMT) *Vodafone Group 3Q Germany Service Revenue Down 6.4%
(07:03 GMT) *Vodafone Group 3Q Rev EUR9.8B
(07:03 GMT) *Vodafone Group 3Q Group Service Revenue EUR7.9B
(07:04 GMT) *Vodafone Group Sees FY25 Adjusted Free Cash Flow at Least EUR2.4B
(07:04 GMT) *Vodafone Group Sees FY25 Adjusted EBITDAaL of Around EUR11.0B
(07:04 GMT) *Vodafone Group Backs FY25 View
(07:42 GMT) Vodafone Launches $496.5 Million Buyback After Revenue Rises

By Najat Kantouar

Vodafone Group launched a share buyback of up to 480 million euros ($496.5 million) and reported higher revenue for the third quarter of its fiscal year.

The London-listed telecommunications company said revenue rose to 9.81 billion euros from 9.35 million euros for the period ended Dec. 31.

Adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization and after lease expenses increased 2.2% on an organic basis to 2.83 billion euros. This was driven by service revenue growth in most markets and lower energy costs in Europe that offset the impact of a TV law change in Germany.

Service revenue--a closely watched metric in the telecom sector--increased to 7.93 billion euros from 7.505 billion euros. Within this, Germany service revenue--which represents 34% of group service revenue--fell 6.4% to 2.89 billion euros due partly to the law change and a lower broadband customer base. Meanwhile, U.K. service revenue climbed 3.3% on organic basis to 1.51 billion euros, boosted by significant investments in customer experience.

Vodafone reiterated its fiscal 2025 guidance, which includes adjusted EbitdaaL of around 11.0 billion euros and adjusted free cash flow to be at least 2.4 billion euros.

Write to Najat Kantouar at najat.kantouar@wsj.com

data.title: Diageo CFO Believes the Group Could Mitigate the Impact in the Long Term
Three of 10 SMEs in Hong Kong Perceive Difficulties in Obtaining Credit Approval, HKMA Says
data.description:
Three out of 10, or 30% of small and medium-sized local enterprises in Hong Kong found it "more difficult" to obtain credit approval in the fourth quarter, according to a survey by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority released Monday.

The perceived difficulty in credit approval is not necessarily an actual difficulty faced by SMEs during the process, but could be affected by factors such as news reports, business conditions, and personal opinions, the central bank said.

The number was higher compared with 24% in the year-ago period, according to the HKMA.

Seventy percent found it easier to obtain credit during the period, the central bank said.

data.title: Indian Rupee Struggles as Trade Tensions Rise, RBI Meeting in Focus
data.description:
The Indian rupee struggled to hold gains on Tuesday after China launched tariffs on US goods in retaliation to President Trump's levies.

The local currency stood at 87.07, down from 87.18 in the prior session, as broader sentiment turned cautious amid escalating trade tensions.

While the immediate reaction to China’s countermeasures was subdued, concerns over global trade disruptions weighed on emerging market currencies, including the rupee.

Foreign investors remained wary, with continued outflows from Indian equities and bonds, adding to volatility.

Meanwhile, crude oil prices hovered near multi-week highs, intensifying concerns over India’s trade deficit and further pressuring the rupee.

Traders awaited key data releases, including industrial output and inflation figures.

Additionally, all eyes were on the Reserve Bank of India’s upcoming monetary policy meeting, where policymakers are expected to address inflation risks and consider measures to stabilize the rupee.
